fields.Title of Presentation: <p>Intergrating AI Into Nursing Curricula: A Framework for Preparing Nurses</p>
fields.Description/Abstract: <p>Abstract:<br>Title: Integrating AI into Nursing Curricula: A Framework for Preparing<br>Nurses<br>Purposes/Aims:<br>To develop and implement a comprehensive framework for integrating AI<br>literacy and ethics into nursing education, preparing nursing students to<br>effectively and ethically engage with AI technologies in healthcare setting<br>Rationale/Background:<br>The rapid introduction of generative AI into healthcare and higher<br>education has created an urgent need for nurses to understand how AI<br>technologies work, the potential for incorporating AI into healthcare<br>workflows, and to critically evaluate how these technologies impact t<br>nursing profession. This project addresses the need to integrate AI literacy<br>into the nursing curriculum, ensuring that future nurses can safely and<br>effectively decide and advocate for how these technologies may or may n<br>be incorporated into nursing care.<br>Brief description of the undertaking/best practice:<br>Approach: We developed a framework consisting of three key components:<br>technical literacy, ethical and practical considerations, and practical<br>applications. This framework was designed to be flexible and adaptabl<br>allowing for integration into existing courses or development of standalone<br>AI modules.<br>Methods: The framework was implemented in an entry-level course<br>covering basics of technology, informatics, ethics, and privacy in healthcare.<br>A two-week AI module (approximately 6 hours of instruction) was<br>10/8/24, 10:52 AM Submission Proof<br><br>https://win.confex.com/win/2025/general/papers/index.cgi?username=19799&password=285644 1/4<br><br>developed, emphasizing core questions: What is AI? How does it work? How<br>do I use it? Why is it important in healthcare? What are the ethical and<br>policy considerations?<br>The module included:<br>1. Introduction to AI concepts and Large Language Models (LLMs)<br>2. Hands-on activities with AI tools (ChatGPT, Gemini, DALL-E)<br>3. Practical exercises using AI for patient education, case study analysis,<br>and student focused use-cases<br>4. Exploration of healthcare ethics principles and the nursing delegation<br>model in the context of AI<br>5. Discussion of how AI is currently embedded in healthcare, and future<br>directions of use.<br>Assessment: Student engagement and learning were assessed through<br>participation in hands-on activities, completion of reflection exercises,<br>final project demonstrating application of AI concepts to a healthca<br>scenario, and formal mid-semester assessments of teaching strategy.<br>Assessment of findings/outcomes achieve<br>Initial observations, student feedback, and formal mid-semester<br>assessments have been promising. Students showed high levels of<br>engagement, particularly with hands-on AI Lab sessions. These practical<br>experiences proved effective in explaining AI technologies and encouragi<br>exploration. Students demonstrated improved understanding of AI's<br>potential applications in healthcare settings and increased awareness of the<br>need to balance technological advancements with ethical considerations<br>and patient-centered care.<br>Conclusions and next steps:<br>This project demonstrates a potential model for integrating AI education<br>into nursing curricula. Next steps include:<br>1. Refining the framework based on student and faculty feedba<br>2. Scaffolding AI incorporation into other courses in the nursi<br>program<br>3. Developing faculty training programs to enhance AI literacy among<br>educators<br>4. Collaborating with healthcare institutions to ensure alignment with<br>industry needs<br>5. Conducting longitudinal studies to assess the long-term impact of AI<br>education on nursing practice and patient outcomes</p>
